1.label: Motion Sensor's Sensitivity
1.description: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.

2.label: Motion Sensor's Blind Time (Insensitive)
2.description: Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind”.

3.label: PIR Sensor’s “PULSE COUNTER”
3.description: Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion.

4.label: PIR Sensor’s “WINDOW TIME”
4.description: The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.

6.label: Motion Alarm Cancellation Delay
6.description: Period of time after wich Motion alarm will be cancelled.

8.label: PIR Sensor Operating Mode
8.description: The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active.

options.label: PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only

9.label: Night / Day
9.description: The parameter defines the difference between night and day.

12.label: BASIC command class configuration
12.description: Determines the command frames sent in 1st association group.

14.label: BASIC ON command frame value
14.description: The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device.

16.label: BASIC OFF command frame value
16.description: The value of 0 allows to turn OFF a device.

20.label: Tamper Sensitivity
20.description: The parameter determines the changes in forces.

22.label: Tamper - alarm cancellation delay
22.description: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

24.label: Tamper Operating Modes
24.description: The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports.

options.label: Tamper/No cancellation plus Orientation in space

26.label: Tamper Alarm Broadcast Mode
26.description: Alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode.

options.label: Tamper alarm is not sent in broadcast mode.
Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode.

40.label: Illumination Report Threshold
40.description: Change in level of light intensity resulting in illumination report.

42.label: Illumination Reports Interval
42.description: Time interval between consecutive illumination reports.

60.label: Temperature Report Threshold
60.description: Change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report.

62.label: Interval of Temperature Measuring
62.description: The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured.

64.label: Temperature Reports Interval
64.description: How often temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.

66.label: Temperature Offset
66.description: The value to be added to the actual measured temperature.

80.label: LED Signalling Mode
80.description: Way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected.

options.label: LED colour depends on the temperature.
Flashlight mode - LED glows white 10 seconds
LED colour depends on the temperature
LED colour depends on the temperature

81.label: LED Brightness
81.description: The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.

82.label: Lower Ambient Illumination Level
82.description: Below which LED brightness is set to 1%

83.label: Upper Ambient Illumination Level
83.description: Above which LED brightness is set to 100%

86.label: Min Temperature Resulting in Blue LED Illumination
86.description: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.

87.label: Max Temperature Resulting in Red LED Illumination
87.description: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.

89.label: LED indicating Tamper Alarm
89.description: Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue).

options.label: LED does not indicate tamper alarm.
